what's significant about there being no: special boot parameters - installation system page
okay, give it a shot, it will probably work with acpi=off

acpi is the standard used for things like sleep mode (aka ACPI S3), suspend to disk (hibernate or ACPI S4), and events from your computer, such as hitting the power button, temperature readout, closing the lid of your laptop, etc.
well, you can disable ACPI as a kernel parameter... not sure if you can do that with the boot cd
see how you can pass kernel parameters, and then pci=noacpi will disable acpi
okay, I'll find you the line you need to type at boot:... there is a boot: prompt right?
okay, let me be a google ninja for a second
boot back off the CD, when boot: comes up type "linux pci=noacpi"
don't delete it if you have important files there :)
plus, you may be a little frustrated with linux support if your ACPI is broken...
